TextView.android:text: 1)One morning Udai and Vishal were talking to each other face to face at a crossing. If Vishal's shadow was exactly to the left of Udai, which direction was Udai facing?
View Answer
Answer : Option C
2)Y is in the East of X which is in the North of Z. If P is in the South of Z, then in which direction of Y, is P?
View Answer
Answer : Option D \n Explanation: P is in South-West of Y.
3If South-East becomes North, North-East becomes West and so on. What will West become?
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n It is clear from the diagrams that new name of West will become South-East.
4)A man walks 5 km toward south and then turns to the right. After walking 3 km he turns to the left and walks 5 km. Now in which direction is he from the starting place?
View Answer
Answer : Option D \n Hence required direction is South-West.
5)Rahul put his timepiece on the table in such a way that at 6 P.M. hour hand points to North. In which direction the minute hand will point at 9.15 P.M. ?
View Answer
Answer : Option D \n At 9.15 P.M., the minute hand will point towards west.

6)Dev, Kumar, Nilesh, Ankur and Pintu are standing facing to the North in a playground such as given below: 
 1.Kumar is at 40 m to the right of Ankur.
 2.Dev is are 60 m in the south of Kumar.
 3.Nilesh is at a distance of 25 m in the west of Ankur.
 4.Pintu is at a distance of 90 m in the North of Dev. 
 1)Which one is in the North-East of the person who is to the left of Kumar?
View Answer
Answer : Option D \n Ankur is in the left of Kumar. Hence Pintu is in North-East of Ankur.
7)If a boy starting from Nilesh, met to Ankur and then to Kumar and after this he to Dev and then to Pintu and whole the time he walked in a straight line, then how much total distance did he cover?
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n Required distance = 25 m + 40 m + 60 m + 90 m \n Required distance = 215 m

8)Each of the following questions is based on the following information: 
 1.Six flats on a floor in two rows facing North and South are allotted to P, Q, R, S, T and U. 
 2.Q gets a North facing flat and is not next to S. 
 3.S and U get diagonally opposite flats. 
 4.R next to U, gets a south facing flat and T gets North facing flat. 
 If the flats of P and T are interchanged then whose flat will be next to that of U?
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n Hence flat R will be next to U.
9)Which of the following combination get south facing flats?
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n Hence URP flat combination get south facing flats.
10)The flats of which of the other pair than SU, is diagonally opposite to each other?
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n Hence QP is diagonally opposite to each other.

11)Dev, Kumar, Nilesh, Ankur and Pintu are standing facing to the North in a playground such as given below: 
 1.Kumar is at 40 m to the right of Ankur. 
 2.Dev is are 60 m in the south of Kumar. 
 3.Nilesh is at a distance of 25 m in the west of Ankur. 
 Pintu is at a distance of 90 m in the North of Dev. 
 Which one is in the North-East of the person who is to the left of Kumar?
View Answer
Answer : Option D \n Ankur is in the left of Kumar. Hence Pintu is in North-East of Ankur.
12)If a boy starting from Nilesh, met to Ankur and then to Kumar and after this he to Dev and then to Pintu and whole the time he walked in a straight line, then how much total distance did he cover?
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n Required distance = 25 m + 40 m + 60 m + 90 m \n Required distance = 215 m

13)One morning after sunrise, Vimal started to walk. During this walking he met Stephen who was coming from opposite direction. Vimal watch that the shadow of Stephen to the right of him (Vimal). To Which direction Vimal was facing?
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n Sun rises in the east. So the shadow of a man will always falls towards the west. Since the shadow of Stephen is to the right of Vimal. Hence Vimal is facing towards South.
14)Golu started from his house towards North. After covering a distance of 8 km. he turned towards left and covered a distance of 6 km. What is the shortest distance now from his house?
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n

15)P started from his house towards west. After walking a distance of 25 m. He turned to the right and walked 10 m. He then again turned to the right and walked 15 m. After this he is to turn right at 135o and to cover 30 m. In which direction should he go?
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n Hence he should go in the South-West direction.
16)X started to walk straight towards south. After walking 5 m he turned to the left and walked 3 m. After this he turned to the right and walked 5 m Now to which direction X is facing?
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n Hence X will face in the end towards South.

17)Hemant in order to go to university started from his house in the east and came to a crossing. The road to the left ends in a theatre, straight ahead is the hospital. In which direction is the university?
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n Therefore university is in North.

18)After walking 6 km, I turned to the right and then walked 2 km. After then I turned to the left and walked 10 km. In the end, I was moving towards the North. From which direction did I start my journey?
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n The journey was started from the South.

19)Ravi left home and cycled 10 km towards South, then turned right and cycled 5 km and then again turned right and cycled 10 km. After this he turned left and cycled 10 km. How many kilometers will he have to cycle to reach his home straight?
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n
20)Reena walked from A to B in the East 10 feet. Then she turned to the right and walked 3 feet. Again she turned to the right and walked 14 feet. How far is she from A?
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n
